question: Which of the following statements about asexual reproduction is correct?
options: always involves one parent but the offspring are genetically different from the parent
may involve two parents but the offspring is always identical to one parent.
always involves one parent and the offspring are identical to the parent
involves two parents but the offspring is not genetically identical to any of the parents.
answer: always involves one parent and the offspring are identical to the parent

Movement of water across a semi-permeable membrane from a weaker solution to a stronger solution is known as

options: at the same level with the floral parts
at the centre of the floral parts

question: Conservation may be promoted by
Which of the following is a biotic components of an ecosystem?
The process by which plants manufacture their food from carbondioxide and water using energy from the sun is called
Rhizobium which lives in the root nodules of leguminous plants is an example of association known as
Ecology simply means the study of
options: inter-relationship between organisms and their environment
several species of plants and animals
answer: inter-relationship between organisms and their environment

question: A population is best described as
options: a group of organisms of the same species living together
a group of animals and plants living together
a group of insects and grasses
answer: a group of organisms of the same species living together

question: Which of the following instruments is not used in measuring abiotic factors in a habitat
The term syncarpous is used to described a flower when the carpels are
options: lying at different parts of a flower

question: Which of the following structures are characteristics of insect pollinated flowers?
options: Dull coloured flowers with no nectar
Very light, numerous and peridulous stamen
Brightly coloured petals, scent and nectar
Flowers are usually small and inconspicuous
answer: Brightly coloured petals, scent and nectar

question: Which of the following is an advantage of dispersal of fruits and seeds? It allows
options: fair distribution of source of food for animals
growth in close association with parent plant
even distribution of plants and reduction of intra specific competition
the seeds to evolve new species
answer: even distribution of plants and reduction of intra specific competition

An association between two organisms in which both benefit is called
Which of the following pairs consists of gametes?
Which of these groups of organisms is responsible for capturing energy for the biotic community?

options: Vegetation consists predominantly of tall trees with thick canopy
Forest is rich in epiphytes and climbers

question: Which of the following is not a way of conserving natural resources?
The transfer of pollen grains from the anther to the stigma of the same flower is known as
Respiration is an essential life process providing the living cells with
A major pollutant around airport residential areas is
The feeding relationship between the organisms labelled III and IV is
The producer is
options: I because it contains the least amount of energy
I because it uses sunlight to manufacture food
IV because it is the largest organism in the diagram
IV because it is the organism that receives the highest amount of sunlight.
answer: I because it uses sunlight to manufacture food

question: Which of the following is not part of the male reproductive system?
About how long does the menstrual cycle takes?
What is a zygote?
options: A cell formed when two embryos join which will develop into a gamete
A cell formed when two gametes join which will develop into a gland
A cell formed when two gametes join which will develop into an embryo
A cell formed when two gland meet to produce an hormone
answer: A cell formed when two gametes join which will develop into an embryo

question: Ovulation is best defined as
options: the release of mature egg cell
the loss of the endometrium lining of the uterus
the joining of a sperm and an egg
the cell passing through the fallopian tube
answer: the release of mature egg cell

question: Which hormone is responsible for the development of male secondary sexual characteristics?
In reproduction, what is fertilization?
options: When a male and female gamete join
When a farmer puts manure on farmland
When a plant drop seeds onto the ground
answer: When a male and female gamete join

question: Which statement about flowering plants is correct?
options: The stamen is the female part of the flower and comprises the filament and anther
The stamen is the male part of the flower and comprises the filament and anther
The carpel is the female part of the flower and comprises the ovary and filament
The stamen consists of pistil and anther
answer: The stamen is the male part of the flower and comprises the filament and anther

question: How are the pollen grains of insect pollinated plants adapted for transfer?
options: They are produced in very large amounts
They are sticky and brightly coloured
Flowers have no scent, no nectar
answer: They are sticky and brightly coloured

question: The transfer of pollen grain from the anther to the stigma of a flower to another of the same species is known as
The arrangement of the ovules in the ovary is known as
When a flower contains both pistil and stamen it is referred to as
The type of reproduction in which eggs are released from the female parents body to hatch and develop in external environment is termed
An effective management of natural resources to ensure their continuous yield from generation to generation may involve all the following except
options: disposal of raw sewage into the sea
answer: disposal of raw sewage into the sea
